summary: A look into the experience of attending a conference, capturing both the academic and social aspects. Through personal storytelling and thematic connections, it offers a deeper understanding of the passion and community within astronomy.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man with glasses and a beard, wearing a brown jacket and a lanyard with a name tag, is seen in a dimly lit parking garage. He is holding a coffee cup and appears to be speaking to the camera, gesturing with his hands as he talks. The background features a parked silver pickup truck and the structural elements of the garage, including concrete pillars and beams. The man's expressions and gestures suggest he is engaged in a lively conversation or presentation. The text "ASTROVLOG" appears on the screen, indicating the title or theme of the video. The overall atmosphere is casual and informal, with the man seemingly sharing his thoughts or experiences in a relaxed setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with the sound of a door opening, followed by a male speaker welcoming the listener to Monday. He mentions being slightly late due to forgetting items at home and needing to retrieve them. He then adds that today will probably be his easiest day.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a parking garage, holding a coffee cup and wearing a brown jacket and a lanyard with a badge. He appears to be speaking, with a pickup truck and concrete pillars in the background. The scene transitions to a bustling convention center, where people in masks walk through a doorway, and a woman in a red dress and mask carries a white bag. The focus shifts to a coffee machine dispensing coffee into a cup, followed by a man in a brown jacket holding a sign that reads 'WELCOME TO TRAPPIST-1e' in front of a NASA-themed backdrop. The video then shows a wall covered with papers, likely part of a conference exhibit, and concludes with the same man in the brown jacket, now with a white mask hanging from his shoulder, speaking in a convention hall with people and booths in the background. The atmosphere throughout the video is lively and professional, with a focus on the man's interactions and the various settings he is in.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker expressing excitement about giving a talk and students giving talks. He is speaking in an excited tone, then we hear jazz music with a bright tone, featuring a saxophone, playing in the background.  The music transitions to background noise including speech and other indistinct chatter. We hear a male speaker voice concerns about not being able to see posters displayed at random and expresses value in browsing around and looking casually at information. The background noise is present through the duration of this segment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a brown jacket and a white face mask hanging from his ear, standing in a large indoor space with several people and computer screens in the background. He is seen talking and gesturing with his hands. The scene transitions to the same man standing next to another man wearing a black vest and a patterned shirt, with text overlaying the image that reads, "My former undergrad from WWU, Riley Clarke!! So proud of you!" The video then shifts to a woman standing at a podium in a conference room, giving a presentation to an audience. The podium has a sign that reads "241" and the background features a large screen displaying a presentation slide titled "Education & Outreach from the beginning." The woman is dressed in a black outfit with a patterned skirt and is holding a microphone. The scene then transitions to a man browsing through a clothing rack at a convention booth, wearing a plaid shirt and jeans. The video continues with a close-up of a hand spinning a colorful fidget spinner on a white countertop, followed by a woman in a white cardigan and black pants standing at a booth with a sign that reads "LC Las Cumbres Observatory." The woman is seen talking and gesturing with her hands. The video concludes with the woman continuing to speak and gesture, with the booth and other attendees visible in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a short exchange between two male speakers, one greeting the other with "Hey," and the second responding with an enthusiastic "Yeah." This interaction leads into a confident statement from one of the men: "Make me proud right here." Following this, a different male voice is heard discussing the demand and desire for collaborative work on high-quality educational initiatives, speaking in a measured tone. This is interrupted by a female speaker, who discusses the work of the Rubin Observatory, elaborating on the subsystems and big components being built there. The clip concludes with the distinct sound of jazz music, energetic in style and featuring what appear to be horns or similar wind instruments.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a person wearing a white mask and a backpack, standing in a large indoor space with a high ceiling and several screens in the background. The person is holding a white mug with a blue logo and text that reads 'first aid alcohol pads' (indicating the mug is likely a promotional item for a health-related event or organization). The scene transitions to a close-up of a model of a telescope, placed on a table with a purple tablecloth, surrounded by other items such as brochures and a wooden model. The focus then shifts to a digital display showing a blue, three-dimensional image of a celestial object, possibly a star or galaxy, with a swirling pattern. The video then returns to the person holding the mug, who appears to be speaking or presenting, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The person is wearing a plaid shirt and a lanyard with a badge, suggesting they are a participant or organizer at the event. The background shows other attendees and booths, with one booth labeled 'NOIRLab,' indicating the event is related to astronomy or space science. The video concludes with a wider shot of the venue, showing more attendees walking around and engaging with the exhibits, creating a lively and interactive atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with jaunty jazz music featuring a piano, creating a lighthearted mood. A male speaker expresses his enjoyment, specifically noting the presence of fidget spinners and yo-yos. He remarks on the use of notation pads and the 3D quality of something he sees.  The speaker then lightheartedly mentions bringing coffee to Seattle before stating his intention to attend a plenary talk and expressing satisfaction with the poster hall and the swag he's acquired. He also notes the changes in people's appearances due to masks, which makes recognition a bit difficult. The music fades out, and a different male speaker gives a formal welcome to someone, followed by applause. Finally, a third male speaker begins a presentation.

events_list.video_caption: The video captures a scene from a conference or lecture held by the American Astronomical Society (AAS). The setting is a large auditorium filled with an attentive audience, seated in rows facing a stage. On the stage, a speaker stands behind a podium, addressing the audience. The backdrop features a large screen displaying a vivid image of a celestial event, possibly a supernova explosion, with the AAS logo prominently displayed. The lighting in the room is dim, with a warm, orange hue illuminating the stage and audience, creating an atmosphere of focus and engagement. As the video progresses, the camera angle widens to reveal more of the audience and the stage setup, including additional screens displaying presentation slides. The slides contain text, one of which reads "Towards an Explanatory Demographics of Exoplanets," indicating the topic of the lecture. The audience appears engaged, with some individuals taking notes or using electronic devices. The overall atmosphere is one of intellectual curiosity and academic discourse.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with an enthusiastic female speaker expressing excitement about discussing "the emerging picture of planet populations." She then highlights her intention to take "a step up" and look at this picture "on a full scale," aiming to build "a complete census of planets in our galaxy." She conveys her intent to explain why she finds this interesting, exciting, and possible. In the background, there's a consistent, subdued hum suggesting a public address system or some form of electronic equipment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a crowded conference room filled with attendees, some standing and others seated, all focused on a presentation. The room is dimly lit, with a large screen displaying a graph and text in the background. The text "Standing room only!!" appears on the screen, indicating the high demand for space. The scene transitions to a close-up of a person wearing a lanyard, suggesting they are a participant or speaker at the event. The camera then shifts to a wider view of the conference hall, showing attendees mingling and walking around. The video then highlights a black face mask with the text "American Astronomical Society" embroidered on it, emphasizing the event's affiliation. The focus moves to a model of a satellite on display, showcasing the event's scientific theme. The video concludes with a close-up of a microscope, symbolizing the scientific research being presented, and a group of people conversing near an exit, indicating the end of the session or a break. The overall atmosphere is one of engagement and intellectual exchange.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a female speaker presenting information in an academic tone. She states that "abundance of chondrites increases as you move further out from the star" and questions what that tells you about "formation in the protoplanetary disk." This transitions to a musical piece featuring jazz piano. The tone is upbeat and positive. There are occasional percussive elements. In the background, indistinct chatter can be heard, hinting at a public setting.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman wearing a white mask and glasses, standing in a lobby area with a backpack on her shoulders. She is pointing upwards with her right hand, and behind her, there is a glass door with a sign that reads "EXIT" in green letters. The lobby is well-lit with natural light coming through large windows, and there are plants and a blue trash bin in the background. A woman in a denim jacket is standing to the left, and another person is walking in the background. The scene then transitions to a group of four people standing in front of the same glass door. The group consists of two women and two men, all wearing lanyards with badges. The woman on the left is wearing a blue floral shirt and a red skirt, while the man next to her is wearing a gray shirt and black pants. The man in the middle is wearing a black sweater and gray pants, and the woman on the right is wearing a denim jacket over a white shirt and black pants. They are all smiling and posing for the camera, with the same well-lit lobby and greenery visible in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with someone announcing "Exclusive interview with the band, Night Lunch." They then ask, in a neutral tone, "What is a Night Lunch?" Background sounds suggest a bustling environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a group of individuals engaged in a conversation in a well-lit indoor setting with large windows. The central figure, wearing a patterned sweater and a lanyard, is actively gesturing and speaking, while the others, including a person in a denim jacket and another in a blue shirt with a name tag reading "Brett Morris," listen attentively. The background shows an outdoor area with greenery and a sign that reads "EMERGENCY EXIT ONLY NO RETURN ACCESS," indicating the location is likely a public or institutional building. The atmosphere is casual and collaborative, with the participants appearing engaged and focused on the discussion. The video captures the dynamic interaction among the group, highlighting their expressions and gestures as they communicate.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker describing a "night lunch" scenario involving telescope work, catered services, and solitude. His tone is casual, with a slight emphasis on the drama of the experience. A second male voice speaks, describing his perspective about night lunches, presenting it as "dangerous" and "exciting". The sounds are ambient with possible faint human speech and outdoor wilderness-like background noise that evoke a remote outdoor setting.

events_list.video_caption:
The video begins with four individuals standing in front of a glass door, each wearing name tags and casual attire. The person on the left is dressed in a blue shirt with a red skirt, while the others wear a mix of shirts and jackets. The text "Tuesday, Sunset Tavern in Ballard, 8pm!" appears on the screen, indicating an event scheduled for that day. The group seems to be posing for a photo, with the person on the left gesturing towards the camera. A child briefly enters the frame, adding a dynamic element to the scene. The background shows a modern building with glass walls and a visible outdoor area.

The scene transitions to an indoor setting where a woman in a white top and yellow skirt stands behind a table with a large screen displaying various images and text. The screen shows a collage of photos and information, including a section titled "All Women in 2019," suggesting a focus on women's achievements or events. The woman appears to be presenting or explaining something, as she gestures towards the screen. The background features a counter labeled "GRILL" and other people engaged in activities, indicating a conference or event environment. The atmosphere is professional and informative, with a focus on showcasing content related to the event.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a question about a performance, followed by a female speaker announcing their show details - "Tuesday, January 10th at the Sunset Tavern," with an opening time of 8 PM. The speaker sounds enthusiastic and promotional, mentioning they will "be rocking hard." Immediately after, a brief conversational snippet with another female speaker is heard, with an excited tone. The clip also has background ambiance, containing indistinct chatter which indicates a social environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a spacious indoor setting, likely a convention center, where attendees are seen wearing face masks and engaging in conversations. A woman in a star-patterned top and a maroon mask is prominently featured, gesturing as she speaks. The background shows a large room with beige walls, a few people standing near a door, and a table with a computer monitor displaying a map. The scene transitions to a large screen displaying a presentation titled "How Astronomy on Tap Changed My Life," featuring stories of individuals whose lives were impacted by Astronomy on Tap. The presentation includes text and images, such as a group photo labeled "Aot NYC March 2018." The video then shifts to a bustling convention floor, where attendees are seen walking, conversing, and engaging with various booths and displays. The atmosphere is lively, with people wearing lanyards and badges, indicating their participation in the event. The video continues to capture the dynamic environment of the convention, with attendees interacting and exploring the space. A man in an orange plaid shirt and a white mask is seen speaking directly to the camera, gesturing with his hands, and expressing himself animatedly. The background features a booth with a sign reading "GBT," indicating the presence of various exhibitors and the ongoing engagement of attendees. The video maintains a focus on the lively and interactive nature of the convention, highlighting the diverse activities and interactions taking place.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip presents a busy indoor scene. People are conversing, and a female speaker mentions finding stories about how astronomy on tap made a difference in their career path. A male speaker reminds attendees that the exhibit hall will close at 6:30, calling it “time to bring it in for a landing.” Another male speaker discusses iPosters, finding the big screens to be successful. He wishes they were up for longer, noting it’s been a day full of reunions. He mentions how many exciting conversations he has had with people and seeing changes in their lives. The clip ends with the male speaker proudly referencing his student collaborator Riley and his poster. The overall audio scene is filled with ambient sounds that imply a large gathering within an exhibition hall.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a plaid shirt and a lanyard, standing in a large, well-lit convention hall. The individual is seen gesturing with their hands, possibly explaining or discussing something. The background is bustling with activity, featuring various booths and banners, including one with the text "GBT" and an image of a person. The scene then transitions to a large auditorium filled with an audience, where a speaker is addressing the crowd. The text "ASTROVLOG" is prominently displayed on the screen, indicating the theme or title of the event. The atmosphere is professional and focused, with the audience attentively listening to the speaker.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker expressing excitement about a student's press release and an upcoming talk, then transitioning to an announcement cutting off the event. The speaker provides information about local events and the clip concludes with "That's it for day one, thanks for watching." Throughout, upbeat and jazzy background music accompanies the speech. Ambient sounds suggestive of a bustling public space are also audible.
